alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 2:21AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL PERSIST FOR VALDEZ AND THOMPSON PASS THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers are expected to move north across Valdez and Thompson from early morning Tuesday through Tuesday afternoon. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in heavier snow showers along with reductions in visibility to as low as one quarter mile at times. New snow accumulations of up to 6 inches are possible for Valdez and Thompson Pass. These bands of snow showers are expected to taper off by mid-afternoon Tuesday. Another round of snow showers is expected to develop late Tuesday night and continue into Wednesday morning, with an additional 2 to 3 inches of snow possible. Motorists are urged to slow down and use caution while traveling. Please visit www.weather.gov/afc for updates to the forecast. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
